required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Milk Supplementation and Bone Health in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Yili Child Formula Milk on Bone Health in 4-6 Year Children: a 12-month Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Objectives: to examine the effects of a Yili child formula milk and regular milk on bone health and growth in young children.
Study design: cluster randomized controlled trial.
Setting: kindergartens in Hui-ning County of Gansu Province, China (north west).
Participants: >=246 apparent healthy children aged 4-6 years old.
Interventions:
(I) Yili child formula milk (QQ star formula, SCI-PRO NUTR5+6TM), 195 ml *2 /day; (II) Yili regular milk (pure milk), 195ml*2 /day; (III) Controls: about 50g/d grain foods (containing 20-30 g carbohydrates), e.g. bread.
Interventional Duration: 12 months.
Outcome measures: determined at 0, 6 and 12 months post treatments. Primary outcomes: bone density and bone mineral contents at the forearm and heel, bone biomarkers.
Secondary outcomes: (1) anthropometric indices: weight, height, waist circumference, etc.; (2) immune status.
Other measures: dietary intakes, physical activities, general information, medical information, adverse of side effects.
Data Analyses: The one-year changes and percent changes in the primary and secondary outcomes will be compared among the 3 groups.

study_design_info.masking_description: The two milk products have the same-looking package and similar taste.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline bone mineral density (BMD) at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: BMD (g/cm2) determined by a dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) at the left forearm and heel

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline bone mineral density (BMD) at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: BMD (g/cm2) determined by DXA at the left forearm and heel

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline bone mineral contents (BMC) at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: BMC (g) determined by DXA at the left forearm and heel.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline bone mineral contents (BMC) at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: BMC (g) determined by DXA at the left forearm and heel.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of bone-specific alkaline phosphatase at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Bone turnover marker 1: Bone-specific alkaline phosphatase

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of bone-specific alkaline phosphatase at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Bone turnover marker 1: Bone-specific alkaline phosphatase

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of osteocalcin at 12 months
Change from baseline of osteocalcin at 6 months
Change from baseline of C-terminal telopeptide of type I collagen at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Bone turnover marker 3: C-terminal telopeptide of type I collagen

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of C-terminal telopeptide of type I collagen at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Bone turnover marker 3: C-terminal telopeptide of type I collagen

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of tartrate resistant acid phosphatase at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Bone turnover marker 4: tartrate resistant acid phosphatase

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of tartrate resistant acid phosphatase at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Bone turnover marker 4: tartrate resistant acid phosphatase

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline body weight at 12 months
Change from baseline body height at 12 months
Change from baseline biomarker of body growth at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Biomarker of body growth: insulin-like growth factor 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline immune globulin M (Ig M）at 12 months
Change from baseline immune globulin G (Ig G）at 12 months
Change from baseline immune globulin G (Ig A）at 12 months
Change from baseline whit blood cell at 12 months

other_outcome.measure: Total consumption of milk and dairy food
other_outcome.description: Total consumption of milk and dairy food (in ml/d)

other_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events
other_outcome.description: Adverse events : assessed by using questionnaires of medical conditions, medications related to milk intake
Child behaviours: assessed by using a Child behavior Questionnaire-- parent version. The minimum and maximum values: 26-78; higher scores mean worse outcome.
Physical activity (in MET, h/week): assessed by a Child Physical Activity Questionnaire

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged between 4-6 years;
- female and male
- Can be enrolled into kindergarten/school as a normal child.
- Be willing to drinking milk daily.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Milk allergy or intolerance, did not to be used to drinking milk;
- Had the following diseases/conditions confirmed by a hospital: serious diseases of heart, liver, kidney, brain, hematopoietic system, immunity, thyroid or cancer that need to be hospitalization for more than 1 week or take medication(s) for more than 1 month with the past two years.
- having infectious diseases, e.g., tuberculosis, hepatitis, etc.
- Taking vitamin D, calcium tables or nutrient package;
- Consumed more than 3 times (>600ml) milk each week in the previous month.
- Be not willing to provide informed consent, or have other conditions that were considered to be unsuitable for the study by the investigators.
- Increases of body health were out of the range between 5-8 cm in the last year.

overall_official.affiliation: Inner Mongolia Dairy Technology Research Institute Co., Ltd.

patient_data.ipd_description: Published data based on reasonable request.
